byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and CHARLIE SAVAGE

abstract: Longtime Guantanamo Bay detainee Mohamedou Ould Slahi makes rare public appearance during military hearing; Abu Zubaydah, one of most prominent detainees who was scheduled to attend separate hearing, fails to appear following conflict with prosecutor.
lead_paragraph: In one hearing, the author of a memoir about his time in prison was portrayed as a model prisoner, while elsewhere disruptions at the facility were described.

headline.main: One Guantánamo Detainee Pleads for Release, but Another Does Not Appear
headline.print_headline: One Guantánamo Detainee Pleads for Release, but Another Does Not Appear

snippet: In one hearing, the author of a memoir about his time in prison was portrayed as a model prisoner, while elsewhere disruptions at the facility were described.
